verses.verse: The preparations <WH4633> of the heart <WH3820> in man <WH120>, and the answer <WH4617> of the tongue <WH3956>, is from the Lord <WH3068>.
All the ways <WH1870> of a man <WH376> are clean <WH2134> in his own eyes <WH5869>; but the Lord <WH3068> weighs <WH8505> the spirits <WH7307>.
Commit <WH1556> your works <WH4639> unto the Lord <WH3068>, and your thoughts <WH4284> shall be established <WH3559>.
The Lord <WH3068> has made <WH6466> all things for himself <WH4617>: Yes <WH7563>, even the wicked for the day <WH3117> of evil <WH7451>.
Every one that is proud <WH1362> in heart <WH3820> is an abomination <WH8441> to the Lord <WH3068>: though hand <WH3027> join in hand <WH3027>, he shall not be unpunished <WH5352>.
By mercy <WH2617> and truth <WH571> iniquity <WH5771> is purged <WH3722>: and by the fear <WH3374> of the Lord <WH3068> men depart <WH5493> from evil <WH7451>.
When a man <WH376>'s ways <WH1870> please <WH7521> the Lord <WH3068>, he makes even his enemies <WH341> to be at peace with him <WH7999>.
Better <WH2896> is a little <WH4592> with righteousness <WH6666> than great <WH7230> revenues <WH8393> without right <WH4941>.
A man <WH120>'s heart <WH3820> devises <WH2803> his way <WH1870>: but the Lord <WH3068> directs <WH3559> his steps <WH6806>.
A divine sentence <WH7081> is in the lips <WH8193> of the king <WH4428>: his mouth <WH6310> transgresses <WH4603> not in judgment <WH4941>.
A just <WH4941> weight <WH6425> and balance <WH3976> are the Lord <WH3068>'s: all the weights <WH68> of the bag <WH3599> are his work <WH4639>.
It is an abomination <WH8441> to kings <WH4428> to commit <WH6213> wickedness <WH7562>: for the throne <WH3678> is established <WH3559> by righteousness <WH6666>.
Righteous <WH6664> lips <WH8193> are the delight <WH7522> of kings <WH4428>; and they love <WH157> him that speaks <WH1696> right <WH3477>.
The wrath <WH2534> of a king <WH4428> is as messengers <WH4397> of death <WH4194>: but a wise <WH2450> man <WH376> will pacify it <WH3722>.
In the light <WH216> of the king <WH4428>'s favor <WH6440> is life <WH2416>; and his favor <WH7522> is as a cloud <WH5645> of the latter rain <WH4456>.
How much better <WH2896> is it to get <WH7069> wisdom <WH2451> than gold <WH2742>! and to get <WH7069> understanding <WH998> rather to be chosen <WH977> than silver <WH3701>!
The highway <WH4546> of the upright <WH3477> is to depart <WH5493> from evil <WH7451>: he that keeps <WH5341> his way <WH1870> preserves <WH8104> his soul <WH5315>.
Pride <WH1347> goes before <WH6440> destruction <WH7667>, and a haughty <WH1363> spirit <WH7307> before <WH6440> a fall <WH3783>.
Better <WH2896> it is to be of an humble <WH8217> spirit <WH7307> with the lowly <WH6035>, than to divide <WH2505> the plunder <WH7998> with the proud <WH1343>.
He that handles a matter <WH1697> wisely <WH7919> shall find <WH4672> good <WH2896>: and whoever trusts <WH982> in the Lord <WH3068>, happy is he <WH835>.
The wise <WH2450> in heart <WH3820> shall be called <WH7121> prudent <WH995>: and the sweetness <WH4986> of the lips <WH8193> increases <WH3254> learning <WH3948>.
Understanding <WH7922> is a wellspring <WH4726> of life <WH2416> unto him that has <WH1167> it <WH4148>: but the instruction of fools <WH191> is wickedness <WH200>.
The heart <WH3820> of the wise <WH2450> teaches <WH7919> his mouth <WH6310>, and adds <WH3254> learning <WH3948> to his lips <WH8193>.
Pleasant <WH5278> words <WH561> are as a honeycomb <WH6688>, sweet <WH4966> to the soul <WH5315>, and health <WH4832> to the bones <WH6106>.
There is <WH3426> a way <WH1870> that seems right <WH3477> unto <WH6440> a man <WH376>, but the end <WH319> there are the ways <WH1870> of death <WH4194>.
He <WH5315> that labors <WH6001> labors <WH5998> for himself <WH6310>; for his mouth craves it of him <WH404>.
A ungodly <WH1100> man <WH376> digs up <WH3738> evil <WH7451>: and in his speech <WH8193> there is a burning <WH6867> fire <WH784>.
A perverse <WH8419> man <WH376> sows <WH7971> strife <WH4066>: and a whisperer <WH5372> separates <WH6504> chief friends <WH441>.
A violent <WH2555> man <WH376> entices <WH6601> his neighbor <WH7453>, and leads <WH3212> him into the way <WH1870> that is not good <WH2896>.
He shuts <WH6095> his eyes <WH5869> to devise <WH2803> perverse things <WH8419>: moving <WH7169> his lips <WH8193> he brings <WH3615> evil <WH7451> to pass <WH3615>.
The hoary head <WH7872> is a crown <WH5850> of glory <WH8597>, if it be found <WH4672> in the way <WH1870> of righteousness <WH6666>.
He that is slow <WH750> to anger <WH639> is better <WH2896> than the mighty <WH1368>; and he that rules <WH4910> his spirit <WH7307> than he that takes <WH3920> a city <WH5892>.
The lot <WH1486> is cast <WH2904> into the lap <WH2436>; but the whole disposing <WH4941> there is of the Lord <WH3068>.
